before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"d42jv","text":"Reagents, tips and tubes should be RNAse and DNAse-free, and ideally DNA-low-binding as well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"538vh","text":"Establishing a cell-type-specific chromatin landscape is critical for the maintenance of cell identity during embryonic development. However, our knowledge of how this landscape is set during vertebrate embryogenesis has been limited, due to the lack of methods to jointly detect chromatin modifications and gene expression in the same cell. Here we present a multimodal measurement of full-length transcriptome and chromatin modifications in individual cells during early embryonic development in zebrafish using a novel protocol: single-cell transcriptome with chromatin immunoclevage (scTChIC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
